secure than others and we need to figure out what what's in what's out and doing

to catch them and so we may have to observe users over a long period of time
all right so another approach is to observe hypothetical security tasks so

study again here so this was with over 600 participants and we gave them a

cards and so each participant had to make that judgment 30 times so what did
we find well the first thing we found is that people are really not very good at this
they made a lot of mistakes they missed a lot of attacks the compare and select
approach actually caused more mistakes than the compare and confirm approach the text formats were all pretty similar
it doesn't really matter whether you use numbers or words we had about the same error rate for all of them the different
graphical formats varied more they were faster for participants but some of them
were really bad in particularly the unicorn was really really bad it was

net that's where you have to go this was a very successful fish almost everybody

mention is how to attract attention to key information in warnings now a little
background here warnings are about hazards and hazards some hazards are
always dangerous so you should never put your baby in a coffee maker you should never drink poison and you should never

the other hand they some hazards that are more contextual sometimes they're dangerous and
sometimes they're not so for example drinking wine in many cases it's not
particularly hazardous to drink wine but if you're about to go drive a car why that's pretty hazardous and if you're

us know our situation we know the context we know if we're pregnant or if we're about to go drive a car and we can

computer security warnings they are often more like wine than poison they
are also contextual but unfortunately our users tend to not actually know what

these unsafe situations and when we do user studies of warnings we'd really like to test both situations so here's
an example here are two warnings one of them is in a safe situation and one is an unsafe situation take a quick look
and see if you can spot which is which we find that experts are actually pretty
good at this and they they pretty quickly will tell us oh well obviously it's the publisher I can see one of
these publishers looks a little problematic but when we show non-experts they are much less likely to notice this
